visual.name: Time series decomposition
visual.description:
Time series decomposition is an essential analytics tool to understand time series components and to improve a forecast. The current visual implements the well-known “Seasonal and Trend decomposition using Loess” approach, and provides several types of plots. You can control the algorithm parameters and the visual attributes to suit your needs.

Service prerequisites: R-powered custom visual is used in service seamlessly

Desktop prerequisites: To run R scripts in Power BI Desktop, you must separately install R on your local computer.
You can download and install R for free from the Revolution Open download page or the CRAN Repository

R package dependencies(auto-installed): proto, zoo

Supports R versions: R 3.3.2, R 3.3.1, R 3.3.0, MRO 3.3.1, MRO 3.3.0

settings_model_params.description: Adjust the type of decomposition and the seasonality

modelType.description: Switch between additive and multiplicative decomposition models

settings_algo_params.description: Modify parameters for 'Seasonal Decomposition of Time Series using Loess'

degree.description: Degree of locally-fitted polynomial in seasonal extraction and trend extraction

robustToOutliers.description: Indicates whether robust fitting will be used in the Loess procedure

settings_plot_params.description: Select the plot type and visualisation attributes

cranPackages.name: zoo
cranPackages.displayName: zoo: S3 Infrastructure for Regular and Irregular Time Series
